Package model.Robots.FireFightersRobots

Class Robot

java.lang.Object
model.Robots.FireFightersRobots.Robot
All Implemented Interfaces:
CustomDrawable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CrawlerRobot, DroneRobot, LegRobot, WheelRobot
public abstract class Robot
extends java.lang.Object
implements CustomDrawable
Represent an abstract robot

      protected static double travelTimeSec​(double speed, double distInM)
      Compute the travel time on a given cell for a given speed
      Parameters:
      speed - the travel speed
      distInM - the distance in meter
      Returns:
      the travel time in seconds

    • isInactive

      public boolean isInactive()
      Returns:
      true if the robot can be hired, false if it is busy

    • pourWater

      public abstract int pourWater​(int volume)
      Pour the given volume if possible
      Parameters:
      volume - the volume to be poured
      Returns:
      the volume poured (equal to volume param if robot's remaining water volume was enough, robot's remaining water volume otherwise)

    • getCellTravelTime

      public abstract double getCellTravelTime​(Cell cSrc)
      Compute travel time of the robot on the given cell
      Parameters:
      cSrc - the related cell
      Returns:
      the time the robot would take to travel from this cell to one of its neighbour

    • interventionTimeMs

      public abstract int interventionTimeMs​(int interventionVolume)
      Compute the intervention time of a robot for a given volume
      Parameters:
      interventionVolume - the intervention volume
      Returns:
      the time taken by the robot to pour that volume

    • getRefillTimeMs

      public abstract int getRefillTimeMs()
      Compute the robot refill time
      Returns:
      the time needed by the robot to refill itself in milliseconds

    • unitaryInterventionToUse

      protected int unitaryInterventionToUse​(int interventionVolume, int unitaryInterventionVolume)
      Compute the number of unitary interventions required for the given volume
      Parameters:
      interventionVolume - the volume of the intervention to perform
      unitaryInterventionVolume - the unitary intervention volume
      Returns:
      The number of unitary interventions required for the given volume if the tank of the robot was full enough. The number of remaining unitary interventions otherwise.
